column4: banshee is definitely slimmer than amarok, but still has nifty web integration. Rythmbox is great if you just want a straight up player
I already have mpd for web integration, just want a player that's slim.
I'm impressed, Rhythmbox looks like it's not crap.
good deal
Nevermind, it doesn't properly scan the folder I told it to, and it's got a ton of import errors on the first attempt. It also seems to not have a file system browser.
are you running gnome?
look into ario
and goggles
Ario is a front-end to mpd.
maybe those will behave better for you
ya
is that a problem?
see if you like goggles
mpd front-ends tend to not have many features.
Okay, thanks.
Amarok has lots of features, but it seems to have been written by idiots, because it barely performs.
ya, amarok sucks in performance. But if you like it otherwise, it might be worth trying out the mysql backend for it, it does speed it up substantially
and banshee is good if you haven't already tried it
i have never used goggles, but I have always wanted to, it looks cool. Might be just what you are after
agreed
Where is goggles? It's not in the apt-cache at all.
